        Parameters:

      • setGameButtonText

        public void setGameButtonText(java.lang.String text)
        Sets the text of the Multi-Purpose Button. (Used for either "Reset" or "Start Game")
        Parameters:
        text - The text to set

      • showMessage

        public void showMessage(java.lang.String msg)
        Shows a pop-up message to the user. The program only continues when the pop-up is closed by the user.
        Parameters:
        msg - Message to show

      • showNonBlockingMessage

        public void showNonBlockingMessage(java.lang.String msg)
        Shows a non-blocking pop-up message to the user. The program continues execution while the pop-up is open (e.g. Incoming messages still get processed).
        Parameters:
        msg - Message to show

      • printMessage

        public void printMessage(java.lang.String message,
                         boolean selfIsAuthor)
                  throws javax.swing.text.BadLocationException,
                         java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                         java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                         javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException,
                         javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException,
                         javax.crypto.BadPaddingException,
                         java.io.IOException
        Prints a message to the GUI and formats it. Own messages are displayed on the right, messages from the other user are displayed on the left. Also checks if the message contains forbidden characters or exceeds the character limit of 2000 characters.
        Parameters:
        message - String to print
        selfIsAuthor - True if yourself are the author
        Throws:
        javax.swing.text.BadLocationException
        java.security.InvalidKeyException
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException
        javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException
        javax.crypto.BadPaddingException
        java.io.IOException

      • printTicTacToe

        public void printTicTacToe(java.lang.String[] moves)
        Prints the current TicTacToe game to the GUI.
        Parameters:
        moves - An array storing the current playing field

      • setup

        public void setup()
           throws java.net.UnknownHostException
        Draws the Setup window to the screen. As soon as the user exits the Setup, the flag setupDonw is set to true.
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException

      • main

        public void main()
        Draws the main GUI window to the screen. It also registers event handlers to handle button presses. Here, the user can use the chat and play TicTacToe.
